description.narrative: Education system managers have capacities and tools for better decentralized management of equitable and quality education services, including in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Evaluation And Research, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-aged girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable, those affected by crises or those living in rural areas, acquire fundamental knowledge and instrumental skills necessary for life in a safe, protective and inclusive school environment.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education system managers have capacities and tools for better decentralized management of equitable and quality education services, including in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF, as the sector lead agency, led the policy support to accompany the elaboration of the transitional education sector plan and signature of the partnership framework, as well as improving the quality and utilisation of the education data and conducting studies to build the evidence base for the sector. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of School Management Committees using school-data
Number of communities who participate in the management of schools and early learning centers (through mention in the Community Development Plan)
